span.p: On March 30, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine made an announcement extending the order that all of Ohio’s public, community, and private K-12 school buildings remain closed to students through May 1, 2020, due to the coronavirus health crisis. The Governor also stated in his Press Conference/Update that he would revisit the situation closer to May 1, 2020.

Our teachers and administrators are continuing to work diligently to provide your child with educational opportunities. I am very impressed and proud of our teachers and administrators and how they have adjusted, learned and experimented with a very different style of instruction and learning. I know they will continue to work through these unprecedented times and follow the guidance of Governor Mike DeWine and the Ohio Department of Education. We will continue to keep you updated as we work through the district’s plans moving forward.
We do want to address a few items, however, we encourage families to visit our FAQ for Parents on our district website at www.eaton.k12.oh.us.

Our professionals are reaching out to families to ensure they have open lines of communication during the closure, and to make alternative plans if necessary. Our counselors will be monitoring emails and reaching out to our school families in need.

If you or your child is unsafe, please use the crisis resources available on our district website. If you and your child need on-going support and services, please use the on-going support resources. Please be mindful that providers will deal with crises of self-harm or significant and impending harm to others immediately, but providers may delay an intake for on-going support dependent upon their system’s availability and resources to provide services via electronic means.

p.strong: What does this mean for graduation?

span.p: Our high school administration and teachers will be working together to ensure that students in the Class of 2020 are on track to graduate. The district is waiting to receive more guidance from the Ohio Department of Education. Know that we will work together to provide assistance and flexibility in the interest of doing what is right for students.

Additionally, we know there are many questions pertaining to upcoming events such as Graduation, Prom, FFA events, and Field Trips. With the Governor’s announcement of extending school closure through May 1st, we will continue making potential plans to resolve topics such as these in order to give our students the best experience we can before the 19-20 school year ends.

We will continue to do the best we can given this very fluid situation. In addition, since the Governor's announcement today, we have not heard any additional news from the OHSAA regarding the status of the spring sports season but would assume information will be announced shortly.
We will work through this TOGETHER and we will get through this TOGETHER!

Jeff Parker
Eaton Community Schools Superintendent
